page.title: 05WOLSTON & SURROUNDING FARMS
page.content: Most of the farming is of the same type with some livestock and some arable land. Rape is a{favourite crop} and the fields look pretty with their ripe golden yellow flowers even though the smell can be unpleasant. Grove Farm is a mixed farm with 132 acres part of which is used for growing barley, potatoes and silage and part for the grazing of sheep,{cattle}and horses. It has no living accommodation. Fosse Farm is mainly cattle, with a pedigree herd of Fresians which have won prizes at the Royal Show at Stoneleigh. Priory Road Poultry Site provides 2,500,000{ {hatching eggs}a year. Ryton Court Farm has recently become the H.Q. of The Henry Doubleday Research Association which works on{organic farming} principles where the use of chemicals in farming is discouraged.
